item.title: Safe git force push
item.description: You’ve likely been in this situation before. You make some minor code fixes, do git commit --ammend to add them to the current commit, and do git push --force. Then, you happily open pull request and see that you’ve deleted you’re colleagues commit.ðŸ˜© This doesn’t happen so often, but when it does, that’s a bummer. Solution is simple. git push –force Don’t use force push, use --force-with-lease instead! git push --force-with-lease This option allows you to say that you expect the history you are updating is what you rebased and want to replace.
